1004293:0.text: Judging from previous posts this used to be a good place, but not any longer.

1004293:1.text: We, there were four of us, arrived at noon - the place was empty - and the staff acted like we were imposing on them and they were very rude.

1004293:2.text: They never brought us complimentary noodles, ignored repeated requests for sugar, and threw our dishes on the table.

1004293:3.text: The food was lousy - too sweet or too salty and the portions tiny.

1004293:4.text: After all that, they complained to me about the small tip.

1032695:0.text: Every time in New York I make it a point to visit Restaurant Saul on Smith Street.

1032695:1.text: Everything is always cooked to perfection, the service is excellent, the decor cool and understated.

1032695:2.text: I had the duck breast special on my last visit and it was incredible.

1032695:3.text: Can't wait wait for my next visit.

1053543:0.text: We ate outside at Haru's Sake bar because Haru's restaurant next door was overflowing.

1053543:1.text: What's the difference between the two?

1053543:2.text: Their sake list was extensive, but we were looking for Purple Haze, which wasn't listed but made for us upon request!

1053543:3.text: The spicy tuna roll was unusually good and the rock shrimp tempura was awesome, great appetizer to share!

1053543:4.text: We went around 9:30 on a Friday and it had died down a bit by then so the service was great!

1055910:5.text: Don't judge this place prima facie, you have to try it to believe it, a home away from home for the literate heart.

1062641:0.text: This place has got to be the best japanese restaurant in the new york area.

1062641:4.text: I have been going back again and again.

1090587:0.text: Just went here for my girlfriends 23rd bday.

1090587:1.text: If you've ever been along the river in Weehawken you have an idea of the top of view the chart house has to offer.

1090587:2.text: Add to that great service and great food at a reasonable price and you have yourself the beginning of a great evening.

1090587:3.text: The lava cake dessert was incredible and I recommend it.

1118167:0.text: I have never eaten in the restaurant, however, upon reading the reviews I got take out last week.

1118167:2.text: The pizza was delivered cold and the cheese wasn't even fully melted!

1118167:3.text: It looked like shredded cheese partly done - still in strips.

1118167:4.text: I have eaten at many pizza places around NYC and this is hands down the worst.

1145510:0.text: This is a fun restaurant to go to.

1145510:1.text: The pizza is yummy and I like the atmoshpere.

1145510:2.text: But the pizza is way to expensive.

1145510:3.text: A large is $20, and toppings are about $3 each.

1162037:0.text: Planet Thailand has always been a hit with me , I go there usually for the sushi, which is great , the thai food is excellent too .

1162037:1.text: With the great variety on the menu , I eat here often and never get bored .

1162037:2.text: The atmosphere isn't the greatest , but I suppose that's how they keep the prices down .

1212346:0.text: Moules were excellent, lobster ravioli was VERY salty!

1212346:1.text: Took my mom for Mother's Day, and the maitre d' was pretty rude.

1212346:2.text: Told us to sit anywhere, and when we sat he said the table was reserved.

1212346:3.text: Stepped on my foot on the SECOND time he reached over me to adjust lighting.

1212346:4.text: Tiny dessert was $8.00...just plain overpriced for what it is.
